ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class ColorCalibrator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.ColorCalibrator

  • public class ColorCalibrator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to check the color of a ring under a light sensor
    Author:
    Caspar Cedro, Percy Chen, Patrick Erath, Anssam Ghezala, Susan Matuszewski, Kamy Moussavi Kafi

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ColorCalibrator.Color
      This enumeration contains the possible colors of the ring under a light sensor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ColorCalibrator() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ColorCalibrator.Color getColor()
      This method gets the last color of the ring under the light sensor
      static ColorCalibrator.Color getColor(int r, int g, int b)
      This method returns the color of the ring currently under the light sensor Instead of intervals, we use a pattern matching for detecting the color For more: reference the software and testing document
      static ColorCalibrator.Color getGetColor(int i)
      This method match integer to corresponding color
      static ColorCalibrator.Color getMostFrequenct()
      This method returns the most frequent colour detected from multiple samples
      static void resetFrequency()
      This method resets the colour_frequency array to 0
      static void setFrequency(ColorCalibrator.Color c)
      This method keeps track of how many of each colour were detected by increasing the count in the array

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public static ColorCalibrator.Color getColor(int r,
                                             int g,
                                             int b)
        This method returns the color of the ring currently under the light sensor Instead of intervals, we use a pattern matching for detecting the color For more: reference the software and testing document
        Parameters:
        r - The red value to check for a ring
        g - The green value to check for a ring
        b - The blue value to check for a ring
        Returns:
        A Color enumeration value

      • getColor

        public static ColorCalibrator.Color getColor()
        This method gets the last color of the ring under the light sensor
        Returns:
        current color detected by the lightSensor

      • setFrequency

        public static void setFrequency(ColorCalibrator.Color c)
        This method keeps track of how many of each colour were detected by increasing the count in the array
        Parameters:
        c - The Color detected by the light sensor

      • getMostFrequenct

        public static ColorCalibrator.Color getMostFrequenct()
        This method returns the most frequent colour detected from multiple samples
        Returns:
        most frequent colour detected

      • resetFrequency

        public static void resetFrequency()
        This method resets the colour_frequency array to 0

      • getGetColor

        public static ColorCalibrator.Color getGetColor(int i)
        This method match integer to corresponding color
        Parameters:
        i: - an integer of [0,4]
